text: Hey Guys i cannot save my Template . HubSpot says the Problem is a syntaxerror: „[missing {{token}} value]“ Somebody know how to fix this?

Got a queryparam question for yall. Can I pull in all the IDs from a foreign ID table into an array to check against? In the real estate example (which I probably have memorized by now), there’s just an array of `[1,2,3,4]`, which is great if that’s all you’re ever going to have. I may add more values to my foreign ID table, and would love for the filter to automatically update when that happens. I’m pulling these in as options on a dropdown, so I think this is just a question of syntax
Yea you get the foreign ID column and use `column.foreignIds`
`hubdb_table_column(<tableId>, <columndId or name>).foreignIds` should return a list of all the foreign ids
You'll need to further maps those to their `id` property or `name`
somebody here has worked on a interface to manage multiple hubdb?
we need to work on a “event listing” page editable by the client, somebody has worked in something like this?
Very cool! Can I ask what HubL you used to accomplish this? Or are there any resources out there on how to do this? :thinking_face:
And that just goes in the page's regular meta description field
Was just going to ask that next. Thanks. That's a great starting point. I appreciate it!
I fixed it already thank you!
